post.title: Headless Adaptive Form : Creating a Multi Language Multistep Form
post.content:
# Adding the same behavior to all the steps

As done in the previous step, we can define events for each panel to be visible and hiding the previous panel. 

1. Trigger another event on click of `viewEligibilityConfirmButton` if its parent panel is valid.

```json
"events": {
    "click" : "if(length(validate($parent)) == 0, dispatchEvent('custom:loanDetails'),{})"
},
```

2. Show the `loanDetails` panel on trigger of the `loanDetails` event

```json
"events" : {
    "custom:loanDetails" : "{visible : true()}"
},
```

Perform the same steps for the `loadDetails` and `accountDetails` panel as well. 

```codeDiff
/assets/tutorial/lab2/json/visible-tabs-3.form.json;/assets/tutorial/lab2/json/loan-form-wizard.form.json
```

After completing the steps, your file should look exactly like the JSON Document present [here](https://github.com/adobe/aem-forms-af-runtime/blob/lab2/ui.frontend.react.forms.af/examples/multistep/loan-form-wizard.form.json)

> Note that an extra `action` property would be present in the form downloaded from AEM
